verses.roman:
te 'nyonyam abhisaṁsṛtya
kṣipanto marmabhir mithaḥ
āhvayanto viśanto 'gre
yuyudhur dvandva-yodhinaḥ

synonyms: te—all of them (the demigods and the demons); anyonyam—one another; abhisaṁsṛtya—having come forward face to face; kṣipantaḥ—chastising one another; marmabhiḥ mithaḥ—with much pain to the cores of the hearts of one another; āhvayantaḥ—addressing one another; viśantaḥ—having entered the battlefield; agre—in front; yuyudhuḥ—fought; dvandva-yodhinaḥ—two combatants chose each other.
translation: The demigods and demons came before each other and reproached one another with words piercing to the heart. Then they drew near and began fighting face to face in pairs.
